title: Sampler, 1817
medium:
Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk thread embroidery, linen foundation, painted paper 
Technique: embroidered in stem, satin, knot and couching stitches on plain weave foundation
provenance:
By 1941, Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
1941, Museum for the Arts of Decoration of the Cooper Union
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
description:
Two alphabets, set of numerals, a verse and a landscape within a deep vine border of flowers and grapes. The landscape includes a woman standing by a tree, sheep, and a large basket of flowers.

The verse reads: 
Jesus permit thy name to stand
As the first efforts of an infants hand
And while her fingers o'er this canvass move
Engage her tender heart to seek thy love

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1817.
1817. Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk thread embroidery, linen foundation, painted paper 
Technique: embroidered in stem, satin, knot and couching stitches on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe. 1941-69-98.
